title: Is Braum... really there?
body: So I've been wandering lately... Is Braum even real in the lore? I'm not particularly talking about if he was real at some point in time, I mean, is he recent? I don't remember hem being in any story from his launch, I don't remember us getting any demonstrably real story where Braum is included, just some apparently really old story. So my question to RIOT is: Is Braum just old over exaggerated story/hero of past, that is in game just because the game itself isn't canon, so it doesnt matter if he lives or not?

''I knew he could do it!''

''But before they could celebrate, everything began to rumble and shake. Braum's tunnel had weakened the mountain, and now it was caving in! Riot did state that the Watchers would 'return' _possibly_ in Braum's lifetime. Though they have since retconned Watchers to be related to the Void in some way we're yet to understand (at least beyond Vel'Koz, who I don't know is a Watcher, a creation of the Watchers to control the Void implying they're separate entities or that is what he is and The Watchers/Void are the same). 

Which suggests that his lifespan is limited, and isn't necessarily immortal or timeless. That might change when they redo his lore. 

Whether he's an unwitting Iceborn that is reincarnating throughout time (and thus wouldn't be Braum, same as Ashe isn't Avarosa) I wouldn't know. I'd prefer not, otherwise you might as well lump in Sylas, Olaf, Tryndamere etc and put any Freljordian with exceptional abilities in that category. And as far as I know, Braum wields a True Ice shield, but doesn't manipulate True Ice. Rather the shield itself creates the projectiles and the ice when he slams it. Same as Trundle can create pillars of ice thanks to his weapon, while Sejuanni creates blizzards and Liss spawns it in independently.
